answers.englishExplanationText:
Senior management has developed, implemented and maintained a corporate policy, taking the following into consideration:
- food safety, product quality, legality and authenticity
- customer focus
- food safety culture
- sustainability.
Based on the corporate policy, the senior management has broken down measurable objectives for communication about food safety policies and responsibilities, training, employee feedback on food safety related issues and performance measurement for the relevant departments to meet the food safety and product quality needs.

HO: Group policy  HQSE dated 10/01/2024 signed by Industrial director E .C.
Objectives on food safety, innovation with clean label, waste control, local suppliers  and food safety culture. 
Policy communicated in all training for all staff and  after management review for all sites (no centralized management review).
All sites have dedicated objectives/targets.

Site:
Quality policy dated 2/02/24  with a "POP" ( Performance Oerationnel Pilotage")  approach for food safety culture

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the senior management provides sufficient resources to establish, implement, maintain, review and improve the food safety and product quality management system. Through the use of clear work instructions, an organisational chart and backup rules for staff, senior management ensures that employees are aware of their responsibilities. Monitoring is achieved through internal audits and site inspections among other measures.

HO: Management ensures that employees are aware of their responsibilities through such means as annual individual evaluation interviews ("know-it-all" quiz), signed job descriptions, and internal audits/inspections
Polycomptency matrix updated on 15/04/2024
Job description available for all operators. 
Seen for the new production manager D J dated 15/04/2024

The company has documented, implemented, and based on the sample reviewed during the evaluation, maintained an organisational chart identifying the job functions and responsibilities of those employees whose activities affect food safety. The chart is up to date. The department responsible for quality and food safety management reports directly to the senior management.

HO: Date of last update of the organization chart: 14/04/2024 with new production manager

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the senior management has implemented and applied an up-to-date system of all relevant legislation, scientific and technical developments, industry codes of practice, food safety and product quality issues, and is aware of factors that can influence food defence and food fraud risks. This applies to countries of production and destination.

HO: Procedure PRO 028 for legislation updates.

The company ensures that all important information is available through the following means: subscription to LAMY Dehove, ADEPALE, CITPPM and FICT watchlist, EUROFINS watch for the laboratory part.
The information is analyzed by Central System Quality Manager and an action plan is put in place if necessary. 
Employees are informed by: meeting, training, mailing.

3 sampled product for documentation and traceability. 
Report sent on 21/02/2022, only one reminder for use of "marinated" word on labels (corrective action : product stopped and no use of marinated), this product is no more present on site

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the corporate policy is communicated to all employees. Interviewed employees are aware of the corporate policy content and the policy has been applied consistently.
Elements of food safety culture, including communication, training, feedback from employees and performance measurement on food safety are implemented.
The senior management reviewed all elements of the food safety and product quality management system, including the HACCP plan within a 12 month period, to ensure their continuous suitability and effectiveness. The results of the annual Management Review are used to support the continuous improvement process.

Date of last management review:  31/01/2024 
Management Review Frequency: annual, report on E-444.
KPI completed  with all process

The company has documented, implemented, and based on the sample reviewed during the evaluation, maintained a procedure for the control of documents and their amendments. All documents which are necessary for compliance with the product requirements are available in the latest version. The reasons for any amendments to documents, critical for product requirements, are recorded. The implemented system demontrates effective control over all operations and processes related to food safety and product quality.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, records and documented information are securely stored for the time period required to meet customer and legal requirements, or for a minimum of one year after the specified shelf-life of the food if customer or legal requirements are not available. The implemented system is effective and required records were available during the evaluation.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the company’s food safety management system is a fully implemented, systematic and comprehensive HACCP based plan that follows the Codex Alimentarius principles, good manufacturing practices and good hygiene practices. Legal requirements of the production and destination countries are followed. The HACCP plan is specific to the site and implemented, documented and maintained.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the HACCP plan covers all raw materials, packaging materials, products and every process from incoming goods up to the dispatch of finished products. Product development is covered in the HACCP plan.

answers.explanationText:
Les diagrammes de flux de production sont établis et mis à jour régulièrement. Cependant, il a été constaté que les diagrammes de flux ne comprennent pas les informations relatives à l'introduction des moules en silicone et aux plaques de découpe en polyuréthane, qui sont utilisés dans le processus de production.  

The production flow charts are established and regularly updated. However, it was found that the flow charts do not include input related to silicon molds and polyurethane slicing plates, which are used in the production process.

Diagram 201 version  updated 23/2/2024 for all products including  "gougeres" (panade base dough) with ADP mixer (heated mix), step for automatic eggwash with the new line, topping added, no more use of aluminium trays

answers.englishExplanationText:
4 CCPs have been identified : 
CCP 1: Baking / application of the cooking scale - bibliographic critical limit: minimum core temperature at the end of baking 92°C  (VP 158)
CCP 2: Protective atmosphere packaging - bibliographic critical limit 0,99 % oxygen  (1%)
CCP3: Metal detection - critical limit internal test: no application of the program adapted to the product 
CCP4: Metal detection (except for products in aluminium trays) - FDA critical limit: standard cards not detected - size Fe 1,8mm - Non Fe 2,5mm - SS 4 mm.
All CCPs were verified during the audit (field visit and traceability test)

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation_en.answer: application of the cooking scale - bibliographic critical limit: minimum core temperature at the end of baking 92°C  (VP 158)

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation.answer: application du barème de cuisson - limite critique bibliographique : température minimale à cœur en fin de cuisson 92°C (VP 158)

ccpControlMethodInformation_en.answer: respect of the core temperature of the products at the end of cooking: minimum 92°C on three products surveyed per trolley

ccpControlMethodInformation.answer: respect de la température à cœur des produits en fin de cuisson : minimum 92°C sur trois produits enquêtés par chariot

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation_en.answer: Protective atmosphere packing - bibliographic critical limit 0,99 % oxygen  (1%)

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation.answer: Emballage sous atmosphère protectrice - limite critique bibliographique 0,99 % d'oxygène (1 %)

ccpControlFrequencyInformation_en.answer: tested on 2 samples per trolley (beginning and end)

ccpControlFrequencyInformation.answer: testé sur 2 échantillons par chariot (début et fin)

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation_en.answer: critical limit internal test: no application of the program adapted to the product

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation.answer: limite critique test interne : pas d'application du programme adapté au produit

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation_en.answer: FDA critical limit: standard cards not detected - size Fe 1,8mm - Non Fe 2,5mm - SS 4 mm.

ccpCriticalLimitsInformation.answer: Limite critique FDA : cartes étalons non détectées - taille Fe 1,8mm - Non Fe 2,5mm - SS 4 mm.

ccpControlFrequencyInformation.answer: début et fin et à chaque heure et chaque nouvelle série

ccpControlFrequencyInformation_en.answer: start and end and at each hour and each new series

answers.explanationText:
CPs have been identified: 
- cooling: temperature of the room and products at the end of cooling (static or Acfri cell)
- Marking of finished products (batch and use-by date)
- freezing process temperature too high
Baking validation recorded on QP-001 dated 2/04/2018 and reviewed for all ovens programs using embedded probes. Example seen for program 6 on ovens 4/5/7/8/9/10 for cake carton 260g dated 20/02/2024

answers.englishExplanationText:
The HACCP plan is reviewed once within a 12 month period or whenever significant changes occur to raw materials, packaging materials, processing methods, infrastructure and equipment that impacts food safety.

Last HACCP review dated 14/03/2024

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, documented personal hygiene standards are established, implemented and maintained to minimise food safety risks.
In case of any health issue or infectious disease that may have an impact on food safety, the company is prepared to take actions, including medical screening procedures when applicable, in accordance with local legal requirements to minimise contamination risks.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the requirements for personal hygiene are observed and applied by the relevant personnel, contractors and visitors. The verification, in addition to other aspects, takes place within the framework of internal audits and site inspections.
Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, hygiene usage rules are implemented accordingly.

answers.explanationText:
Dans la salle de dosage, où les produits crus et moins sensibles sont manipulés, des supports inox sont mis à disposition pour les tabliers utilisés en production, avec une séparation claire entre les tabliers propres et les sales. Cependant, lors de la visite, il a été constaté que plusieurs tabliers étaient mal accrochés et traînaient au sol, ce qui peut entraîner un risque de contamination du produit.  

In the dosing room, where raw and less sensitive products are handled, stainless steel supports are provided for the production tables, with a clear separation between clean and dirty tables. However, during the visit, it was observed that several tables were poorly attached and were dragging on the floor, which may lead to a risk of product contamination.

HO: Training plan version 2024 last updated on  14/05/2024. Training plan for 2024  was limited to mandatory and internal food safety training
Hygiene and food safety training are managed  on each site.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the company provides suitable staff facilities including toilets, which are proportional in size, equipped for the number of personnel, designed and maintained to minimise food safety risks.
Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, hand washing facilities are provided, designed and operated to minimise food safety risks.

answers.explanationText:
The shelf lives are: 
- 35 days for the cake range packed in flow packs
- 42 days for the cake range in aluminium trays sealed under atmosphere
- 28 days Mezze range vegetable based cake /Cream/eggs
 
The internal protocol provides for an initial validation of the shelf life on 3 samples from the laboratory tests and then on 5 samples from the pre-series. Application of the AFNOR NF-V01-003 protocol with 1/3 at 4°C and 2/3 at 8°C.

answers.englishExplanationText:
The company investigated the extent to which the factory environment (e.g. ground, air) may have an adverse impact on food safety and product quality. Where it is established that product safety and / or quality is at risk, appropriate control measures have been implemented. 
Outside areas are, based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained to ensure food safety and product quality.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the layout, process flows and processes and procedures are designed, planned, implemented, constructed, maintained and suitable to mitigate all food safety risks. Cross contamination risks are minimized through effective measures for purchased materials, work in progress, rework, packaging and finished products.

The production site is located on one floor, level one for offices and staff premises. Two areas have been identified with two separate entrances/stairs passing through bootwash and handwashing turnslide. The areas are: area for raw products (including preparation of dough, reception, storage for raw materials, ovens, and line end marking and loading bay) and area for cooked products (packaging and slicing).

summaryConditionsOfInfrastructure_en.answer:
The buildings are fit for purpose (2017), they are all well finished and maintained and allow for good hygiene.
The production flow is well defined, reception, storage, unpacking, preparation, dosing, cooking and labelling, palletizing. Forward workflow is followed and units are separated: preparation/dosing is totally separated with personal sluices in place.

summaryConditionsOfInfrastructure.answer:
Les bâtiments sont adaptés à l'usage (2017), ils sont tous bien finis et entretenus et permettent une bonne hygiène.
Le flux de production est bien défini, réception, stockage, déballage, préparation, dosage, cuisson et étiquetage, palettisation. Le flux avant est respecté et les unités sont séparées : la préparation/dosage est totalement séparée avec des sas personnels en place.

answers.explanationText: Absence de fenêtres destinées à être ouvertes pour ventilation.
No plastic curtain
Weighing workshop area is fitted with air extraction.

The company has documented, implemented, and based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained cleaning and disinfection schedules which are effective to minimise food safety risks. The effectiveness of the cleaning and disinfection measures is verified and justified by methods based on risk assessment. Cleaning activities do not represent a food safety risk.

Cleaning is carried out by an external service provider S.: all factory production equipment/ premises+ social premises + administrative premises.
Specification are detailed in the contract and weekly rotation planning in place example seen dated 3/112022

Twice per year fumigation /disinfection for packing area; using ULTRAD Hydroxyacetic acid (MSDS dated, last dated   27/11/2023 triggered after ambient air control 

Cleaning and disinfection procedures applied:   manual cleaning of rooms and equipment.
Devices in place to carry out cleaning: washing tunnel for moulds, room dedicated to cleaning equipment, automatic dilution plant for cleaning products, High pressure, floor scrubber.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the company has competent personnel performing cleaning and disinfection and has implemented the necessary trainings for cleaning and disinfection schedules.

Cleaning and disinfection chemicals are clearly labelled, suitable for their intended use and are stored and used appropriately. During the site tour, it has been observed that chemicals are handled in a way that avoids contamination.

foreignMaterialContaminationMitigationMe.answer: Equipment used to detect foreign bodies are metal detector for all line  no more   aluminium trays for finshed products.
Les équipements utilisés pour détecter les corps étrangers sont des détecteurs de métaux pour toutes les lignes,  plus de barquette aluminium pour les produits finis.

answers.explanationText:
Sur la machine de conditionnement en flowpack U1, des morceaux d'étiquettes utilisés lors des changements de bobine de film sont présents au niveau de l'enroulement du film. Cette situation présente un risque de contamination physique du produit par des corps étrangers, même s'il est considéré faible car les produits sont cuits à cette étape, les morceaux d'étiquettes sont visibles et potentiellement identifiables .

On the flowpack packaging machine U1, pieces of labels used during film reel changes are present at the film winding level. This situation presents a risk of physical contamination of the product by foreign bodies, although this risk is considered low because the products are cooked at this stage, and the pieces of label are visible and potentially identifiable.
Absence de conditionnement en verre ou autre type de contenant à risque, les produits sont dosés en moules dépilés retournés.
No such visual inspection.

answers.englishExplanationText:
The company has documented, implemented, and based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained adequate pest control measures to prevent, monitor and control or eliminate the risks of pest infestation at the site which are in compliance with local legal requirements.
Pest control is managed by : ARTICA. Approval is available. Technician clearance is available.

The contract, signed on 03/01/2020 with the installation of non-toxic/mechanical baits throughout the site, update on 08/08/2022 (storage area for packaging in the "store", includes for 12 routine visits per year (internal rodent traps x32, external x12, attic x 7).

An annual audit was conducted on 13/09/2023 and action plan for proofing some access points, closure with maintenance reviewed on  13/02/2024 during external tour

Internally, 2 inspections per year; trained quality manager dated 29/03/2022), last visit /report 13/02/2024 on iauditor.

Date of last inspection: 8/04/2024 rodents and insects with non infestation detected.

Reports include: level of infestation noted normal trap consumption. No major infestation (no consumption in one year).

In case of infestation, the following measures are implemented: switch to rodenticide and increase the frequency of external and internal control until the situation returns to normal.

pestTargetOrganismsListDescription_en.answer: Rodents: bait station placebo in factory, 12/year

pestTargetOrganismsListDescription.answer: Insectes : DEIV, piège à phéromones (local épices) ; 6 /an

pestInspectionReportFacilitiesActionsLis.answer: Pas d'infestation depuis le dernier audit

answers.englishExplanationText: The company has documented, implemented and, based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained a risk based inspection plan for all incoming goods, including packaging materials and labels. The inspection plan includes a check against specifications to ensure that only materials meeting the food safety and product quality requirements are accepted.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, the company has allocated storage areas and conditions for raw materials, semi-finished, finished products and packaging materials which are in compliance with specifications. During the site tour no negative impact on food safety and quality has been observed.

L'entreprise a mis en place un système d'enregistrement et d'identification à la réception des matières premières par l'attribution d'un numéro de lot interne, visible sur une étiquette "mise à disposition" apposée sur chaque palette. Cependant, il a été constaté en zone de préparation, avant le décartonnage, des cartons de cubes de carottes IQF qui ne présentaient pas cette identification, mais uniquement le marquage initial du fournisseur.   Le risque reste cependant limité, car l'identification initiale du fournisseur permet d'assurer la traçabilité.

The company has implemented a system of registration and identification upon receipt of raw materials by assigning an internal batch number visible on a "release for use" label affixed to each pallet. However, it was observed in the preparation area, before unpacking, boxes of IQF carrot cubes that did not have this identification, but only the initial marking of the supplier.  The risk remains limited, however, as the initial supplier identification maintains traceability.

not GFSI certified an approval audit took place on 6/06/2023 based on check list E-043.

The company has documented, implemented, and based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained an adequate maintenance plan covering premises and equipment (including transport) to minimise food safety risks. Maintenance activities observed during the site tour did not represent a food safety risk.

Use of a CMMS Allmaint for preventive and corrective maintenance

answers.explanationText:
Il a été observé sur la ligne U1, après le détecteur de métaux pour les produits conditionnés, que des vis de fixation du plexiglas sur le côté du capotage n'ont pas été complètement retirées lors du démontage du plexiglas. Cette pratique vise à éviter le risque que les vis ne tombent dans les colis. Cependant, ce risque est considéré comme faible car les vis sont encore partiellement fixées au plexiglas et la zone est située après que le produit soit entièrement conditionné.

It has been observed on line U1, after the metal detector for packaged products, that screws fixing the plexiglass on the side of the hood have not been completely removed when dismantling the plexiglass. This practice aims to prevent the screws from falling into the packages, but exposes the products to a potential risk of contamination by metallic foreign bodies. However, this risk is considered low because the screws are still partially fixed to the plexiglass and the area is after fully packed product area.

answers.explanationText:
L'entreprise dispose d'une procédure de traçabilité documentée, mise en place et tenue à jour, qui permet d'identifier les lots de produits et leur relation avec les lots de matières premières, les emballages en contact direct avec les aliments, les emballages destinés à être en contact direct avec les  aliments ou susceptibles de l'être.
Sur la base des échantillons examinés lors de l'évaluation, la traçabilité est assurée et documentée jusqu'à la livraison au client.
answers.englishExplanationText:
The company has a documented, implemented and maintained traceability procedure, which enables the identification of product lots and their relation to batches of raw materials, packaging in direct contact with food, packaging intended or expected to be in direct contact with food.
Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, traceability is ensured and documented until delivery to the customer.
The traceability system is based on an ERP/infologic system with the attribution of a batch number upon reception for each raw material and packaging, however there is no computer-aided production management. Computer based traceability available for raw materials and packaging. The traceability system is managed in:  80% paper / computer format for receptions.

These numbers are taken up at each stage with the creation of a batch number for the products including the year and the date of manufacture. Shipments are managed by the logistics platform with access to information from each production site.

One batch of finished product corresponds to 1 day of manufacturing and batch numbering is Julian day. 
The batch number is formed as follows:  Year + Julian day of cooking/baking.

First test involved : cake poulet curry  260gr ; private label French retailer A.  batch 024005 ; BBD 09/02/2024 ; production date 5/01/2024; 283 units

packing record on E-083; including CCP2; O2= 0,8%

Weight control on ULMA checkweigher report average 274,49g  no TU1/TU2 
E-070 follow up of dosing weight controls
CCP1:  baking temperature (3 levels of the trolley) 96°C to 98°C
Cleaning records  for washer on E639 , production areas records on ERP copilot and startup check for brittle control
Dispatched to the platform Guyader on 8/01/2024 with  internal shuttle
Product dispatched from 15 to 22/01/2024 from the group platform

Chicken dices IQF from SBV, BBD 7/11/2025, received on 2/01/2024; 1280 kg: used from 05/01/2024 to 12/03/2024 , mass balance: loss 8kg recorded on ERP (0,59%)

The company handles 12 allergens directly.
Previously indirect presence for lupin (flour supplier indicated possible cross contamination) : no more contamination. 
The company does not handle on site peanuts or Lupin.
List of allergens on site on CP 322 updated on 9/03/2023 (including storage areas).
The company has documented, implemented, and based on the sample reviewed during the evaluation, maintained a process to control and mitigate the risks of allergen contamination.  This includes a risk assessment of allergen cross contamination. The labelling of finished products reviewed during the evaluation is in compliance with relevant legislation in country/ies of destination.
In October 2021 a review of cleaning was performed based on 81 tests (ELISA, by external lab for 8 allergens with cross contamination risk), the main conclusion (01/12/2021) is that after cleaning, for a part of allergens the site cannot confirm absence (5 tests were positive to allergen). Labelling of all allergens on site "may contain" is in place for all products.

allergensOnSiteListDescription_en.answer: 12 EU allergens except Lupine and peanuts

allergensOnSiteListDescription.answer: 12 allergènes de la liste UE sauf Lupin et arachide

allergensSummaryMitigationMeasuresListDe.answer:
- listing of allergens, training of personnel
- segregation of allergens in dry storage and spice workshop,
- work equipment specially labeled for allergens or not, 
- special cleaning measures : Rinses are performed on the mixing and cutting equipment between each recipe. Specific shovels are set up for each reference in the preparation areas. For slicing: The site carries out wiping of the material and equipment between each recipe, validated by an internal monitoring plan. At the level of the dosage of the cakes, a cleaning is carried out between each recipe), 
- trace marking (Labelling of all allergens on site "may contain" is in place for all products.)

Liste des allergènes et formation du personnel
Ségrégation des allergènes dans le stockage sec et l'atelier d'épices
Équipements de travail spécialement étiquetés pour les allergènes ou non
Mesures de nettoyage spéciales : des rinçages sont effectués sur les équipements de mélange et de découpe entre chaque recette. Des pelles spécifiques sont mises en place pour chaque référence dans les zones de préparation. Pour la trancheuse : le site effectue un essuyage du matériel et des équipements entre chaque recette, validé par un plan de surveillance interne. Au niveau du dosage des gâteaux, un nettoyage est effectué entre chaque recette.
Marquage des traces (L'étiquetage de tous les allergènes sur le site "peut contenir" est en place pour tous les produits.)

answers.explanationText:
Le prestataire d'étalonnage mentionne que le thermomètre étalon a une plage de mesure de -18°C à 70°C. Cependant, les thermomètres de surveillance, tels que le modèle MICROTEMP2 S/N C23050786, ont une plage de mesure plus large, de -50°C à 200°C, ce qui couvre bien les besoins de l'entreprise.

The calibration provider states that the reference thermometer has a measurement range of -18°C to 70°C. However, the monitoring thermometers, such as the MICROTEMP2 S/N C23050786 model, have a wider measurement range of -50°C to 200°C, which adequately covers the company's needs.
answers.englishExplanationText: All measuring devices reviewed during the evaluation are checked, adjusted and calibrated under a monitoring system, at specified intervals, in accordance with defined recognised standard / methods and within relevant limits of the process parameters values. The results of the checks, adjustments and calibrations are documented.

The scales under legal metrology are connected to a computerized data processing system (Precia Molen) and positioned at the exit of the lines. 

3 checkweighers (on the ULMA 1 , 2 lines and the Delta line) checked daily with standard weights.
At the end of each series, a weighing ticket is printed and then checked by the quality department, as seen in the traceability test.

quantityControlFrequencyMethodologyCheck.answer:
The quantitative control of the finished products is carried out by sampling on a scale under legal metrology or on all the products using a checkweigher under legal metrology.
The frequency of control by sampling is : 30 UVC minimum per batch according to batch size.
Weight controls are based on sampling (30, 50 or 100 weighings depending on the batch size) according to CP-520 instruction of  5/07/2022, for products that are not in lines (bowl of mini cakes).
The lot is considered as compliant when: average of the lot > QN, maximum standard deviation and TU1 and TU2 rules respected.

Le contrôle quantitatif des produits finis est effectué par échantillonnage sur une balance en métrologie légale ou sur l'ensemble des produits à l'aide d'une trieuse pondérale en métrologie légale.
La fréquence du contrôle par échantillonnage est de 30 UVC minimum par lot en fonction de la taille du lot.
Les contrôles de poids sont basés sur l'échantillonnage (30, 50 ou 100 pesées selon la taille du lot) selon l'instruction CP-520 du 5/07/2022, pour les produits qui ne sont pas en ligne (bol de mini cakes).
Le lot est considéré comme conforme lorsque : moyenne du lot > QN, écart type maximum et règles TU1 et TU2 respectées.

answers.englishExplanationText:
A control plan PLC PF  with records, annually reviewed,  updated 26/04/2024  for finished products. It is related to the analysis of raw material risks taking into account the seasonality and volume of production, the product risk or customer requirements.
For raw material based on risk and historical data, sampling is one/ two per year alongside with suppliers analysis.

Once a month, a product is sampled by packaging line and analyzed at Day 0  this correspond to the rule according to PRO 013, for product category and each year 2 tests at Day 0 and 2 at end of shelf life  and for new products at +8°C.
Tastings on finished products are organized every 15 days to test private label products at the end of their life cycle once a year.

Validation of the use-by date is carried out on 5 samples at the start of the product and then on 1 sample during monitoring. Type 1 or 2 nutritional analyses are carried out within the framework of tripartite agreements or by Landrévarzec on sliced terrines. 

All analyses (FCD criteria) for food safety are subcontracted to external COFRAC laboratories: EUROFINS.
No laboratory on site, no analyses on site.
Contaminants and species: GUYADER Group control plan according to raw materials.

For group raw materials: 288 samples in 2023 with 34 non conformance (less than 12%) : mainly for TVC and criteria difference with suppliers. No pathogen issues

For site Kervignac:
513 tests performed for finished products in 2023,  25 not satisfactory / 95,1% (target 95%)
Mainly uue to terrine products slicing high TVC , 70% satisfactory ( 98,5% satisfactory for cakes) root cause analysis gives no main source for TVC growth on terrines

Plan de controle groupe incluant pour chaque site son propre plan (échantillonnage): microbiologiques, pesticides, métaux lourd , mycotoxines

answers.englishExplanationText:
Based on risks, the company has documented and implemented a microbiological environmental monitoring program to reduce the risks of food contamination. Samples reviewed during the evaluation have been found to be compliant with the program.
Last validation of the working environment performed:   15/05/2024

* Dip slides used internally, 357 TVC and coliforms in 2023 (around 25 samples per months) based on "PLC" sampling plan.
Limit for TVC is 50 UFC, limit for Coliform total 1 UFC.
95 % satisfactory ; 15 due coliform found mainly on scales 

*Swabs for Listeria with LBO laboratory:  in 2023 728 samples for Listeria (around 40 per month). Sampling: 199 before production / 529 during production activities
Results were 99 % satisfactory,  8 non conform (sprayer, topping trays, drain, in the mixer Tonelli).
 
*Air sampling during 3 different campaigns in the year (ambient air and compressed air);  24 tests performed in 2023, TVC non conform in  storage  area (2 non conform results for packaging storage: fumigation performed on  27/11/2023). TVC <100; Yeast/moulds <100 and absence of oil residues on absorbent paper

parametersEnvironmentalMonitoringProgram.answer: air analysis : TVC <100; Yeast/moulds <100 and absence of oil residues on absorbent paper.
dipslide microbiological analysis of surfaces  : TVC max 50 UFC, Total Coliform < 1 UFC.
Swabs for Listeria : limit = Absence (external lab)

The procedure includes registration, assessment by competent staff and appropriate actions when necessary.

HO: The procedure PRO 009 dated 4/10/2022 includes registration, assessment by competent staff and appropriate actions when necessary. 
Part of consumer complaints are received by Head office, if clients/ retailers complaints are collected by each site.
A unique Excel spreadsheet Client-conso.

On the 11th of January 2024, several complaints were received regarding the presence of sand grains in products containing sea lettuce (salmon and sea lettuce cakes). An analysis of the cause confirmed that the sea lettuce was the source of the sand. After internal tasting and consultation with the supplier, it was found that the trembling process for certain batches was not sufficient. Corrective action: The internal instructions have been modified to increase the trembling time from 30 minutes to 1 hour.

Head office management.
Quality manual and FM 1000.
Date of incident management procedure, product withdrawal / recall:  
PRO-022 version B du 29/11/2023.
Procedure version: A.

Mock recall dated 26/04/2024; "Terrine  de saumon" batch 24107 (2 slices 60g) BBD 3/05/2024  involving 1449 units; the scenario was suspicion for microbiological contamination for customer French. 100% units retrieved

widthdrawalsCauseDescription.answer:
Withdrawal: 
On December 21, 2023, a withdrawal of 256 units from batch 23353 was initiated. These units were intended for a private label and were part of the mini cakes assortment, each weighing 150g. The reason for this withdrawal was the absence of a warning about potential allergens ("may contain") on the internally printed labels. The retailer decided to pull all the faulty products from the warehouse (no products were in stores). The root cause of this issue was traced back to the verification process of new label stickers

answers.englishExplanationText: The company has documented, implemented, and based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained a procedure for the management of incidents and potential emergency situations with an impact on food safety, quality and legality. The procedure is tested for effectiveness once within a 12 month period.

The company has documented, implemented, and based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained a procedure for the management of all non-conforming raw materials, semi-finished products, finished products, processing equipment and packaging materials. This procedure includes all requested topics.

The company has documented, implemented, and based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation, maintained a procedure for the recording and analysis of non-conformities and non-conforming products as well as any potential food safety issue, with the objective to avoid recurrences by preventive and / or corrective actions.

Based on the samples reviewed during the evaluation corrective actions are clearly formulated, documented and undertaken as soon as possible to avoid the further occurrence of non-conformities. The responsibilities and the timescales for corrective actions are clearly defined.

certificationBodyAddress.answer: 789 N. Dixboro Road, Ann Arbor, MI 48105, USA

companyStreetNo.answer: 17 rue Antonin Carème ZI du Porzo

scopeAuditScopeDescription.answer: Fabrication, tranchage et conditionnement sous atmosphère modifiée ou non, de cakes salés, de plats cuisinés, de pâte à choux (gougères), réfrigérés ou surgelés, en barquettes cartons, plastiques, polystyrène, aluminisées ou flowpack plastiques. Tranchage et conditionnement de terrines de poissons sous atmosphère modifiée ou non en barquettes polystyrène.

companyAdditionalInformation.answer:
Catering division (Guyader Traiteur Frais) = Landrévarzec + Kervignac + new Chateauneuf spreadable: 34% cakes, 22% rillettes, Terrines 32%, individual starters.
The Kervignac site: 93% cakes and sliced terrines 4%. Trend towards smaller UVC products and discontinuation of sweetened activities. Shortbread and sweet cakes which were stopped last quarter of 2022.
In 2022 the production amounted to 1000 tons (5 millions units) for the site of which 48% in private labels and 52% in national brand (93%, 3% export in EU, 3% Food service, 1% Freezer center). Little export to Europe.

companyStructureMultiLocationProductionD.answer:
Guyader Gastronomie comprises 3 branches of activity and a logistics platform:
- Branch Deli and Vegetal products with 2 production sites: Landrévarzec (29) (prepared fish and seafood) (IFS certified, COID 13771), Kervignac(56) (savoury cakes) (IFS certified, COID 63334) and new site PDS in Chateauneuf du Faou (29) (spreadable) (non IFS certified)
- Branch prepared meat products with 2 production sites: St Agathon (22) (IFS certified, COID 52553) and Fouesnant (29) (non certified). 
- Pôle Smoked Fishes with 2 production sites: Châteauneuf du Faou (29) (IFS certified, COID 15304) and Nantes (44) (IFS certified, COID 79952)
- Logistics platform located at Trégourez
The head office of the group is located at the historic site of Landrévarzec.

Multi-site organization: centralized activities at the Landrevarzec headquarters were audited remotely on 01/25/2024 for 8 hours, once for all sites. The activities audited were: Management (Governance and Commitment), R&D, Purchasing, Food Fraud, Quality System (internal audits, recall withdrawal and crisis management, processing and systematic analysis of complaints, Documentary System), HR, Storage / Transport. No deviations were identified during this head office audit.

Guyader Gastronomie comprend 3 branches d'activité et une plateforme logistique :
- Branche charcuterie et produits végétaux avec 2 sites de production : Landrévarzec (29) (préparations de poissons et fruits de mer) (certifié IFS, COID 13771), Kervignac(56) (gâteaux salés) (certifié IFS, COID 63334) et nouveau site PDS à Chateauneuf du Faou (29) (tartinables) (non certifié IFS).
- Branche produits élaborés à base de viande avec 2 sites de production : St Agathon (22) (certifié IFS, COID 52553) et Fouesnant (29) (non certifié). 
- Pôle Poissons fumés avec 2 sites de production : Châteauneuf du Faou (29) (certifié IFS, COID 15304) et Nantes (44) (certifié IFS, COID 79952).
- Plateforme logistique située à Trégourez
Le siège social du groupe est situé sur le site historique de Landrévarzec.

Organisation multisites: les activités centralisées présentes au siège à Landrevarzec on été auditées à distance le 25/01/2024 pendant 8 heures, 1 seule fois pour tous les sites. Les activités auditées sont: Direction (Gouvernance et engagement), R&D, Achats, Food Fraud, Système Qualité (audits internes, retrait rappel et gestion de crise, traitement et l'analyse systématique des réclamations, Système documentaire), RH, Stockage / transport. Aucune déviation n'a été identifiée lors de cet audit siège.

scopeProductGroupsDescription_en.answer: Reception and storage in cold rooms (P6), cooking of fillings (P11), dosing, cooking (P2), cooling of products and storage in cold rooms, deep-freezing (P6), packaging under atmosphere (P8), disinfection of equipment + temperature of the refrigerated room (P9), slicing of terrines, mixing/cutting, labelling, packaging (P12)

scopeProductGroupsDescription.answer: Réception et stockage en chambres froides (P6), cuisson des garnitures (P11), dosage, cuisson (P2),refroidissement des produits et stockage en chambre froide, surgélation (P6),conditionnement sous atmosphère (P8), Désinfection des équipements + température de la salle réfrigérée (P9), tranchage de terrines, mélange/cuterrage, étiquetage, emballage (P12)

scopeCertificateScopeDescription.answer: Fabrication, tranchage et conditionnement sous atmosphère modifiée ou non, de cakes salés, de plats cuisinés, de pâte à choux (gougères), réfrigérés ou surgelés, en barquettes cartons, plastiques, polystyrène, aluminisées ou flowpack plastiques. Tranchage et conditionnement de terrines de poissons sous atmosphère modifiée ou non en barquettes polystyrène.

scopeAuditScopeDescription_en.answer: Preparation, slicing and packing under modified atmosphere or not, of savoury cakes, ready meals, choux pastry (gougères) chilled or frozen, in carton or plastic or polystyrene or aluminum  trays or plastic flow packs. Slicing and packing of fish terrine under modified atmosphere or not, in polystyrene trays.

scopeCertificateScopeDescription_en.answer: Preparation, slicing and packing under modified atmosphere or not, of savoury cakes, ready meals, choux pastry (gougères) chilled or frozen, in carton or plastic or polystyrene or aluminum  trays or plastic flow packs. Slicing and packing of fish terrine under modified atmosphere or not, in polystyrene trays.

companyProfileAdditionalInformation.answer:
Produits fabriqués (secteurs produits 2, 6 et 7) : cakes salés à base de poissons, viandes et légumes, mini-cakes, bouchées salées cuits et/ou tranchés, et réfrigérés sous atmosphère protectrice ou surgelés, gratins de légumes. Essentiellement 2 grandes familles : format Apéritif (160g) et familial (260g), et Bio. Gougères = pâte à choux salée.
Tranchage et conditionnement de terrines de poisson fabriquées par le site de Landrévarzec
En 2023 la production s’élevait à 800 tonnes (1000 tonnes en 2022) pour le site 4,6 millions d’UVC (en hausse) dont 48% en MDD et 52% à la marque nationale (96% cake, 2% export en UE, 3 % Food service, 1% Freezer center). Peu d’export en Europe.
Activité partielle avec autorisation des autorités jusqu’à Juillet (3 ou 4 jours par semaine)

companyProfileAdditionalInformation_en.answer:
Products manufactured (product sectors 2, 6 and 7): savory cakes based on fish, meat and vegetables, mini-cakes, savory bites cooked and/or sliced, and refrigerated in a protective atmosphere or deep-frozen, vegetable gratins. Essentially 2 main families: aperitif (160g) and family (260g) formats, and organic. Gougères = savory choux pastry.
Slicing and packaging of fish terrines manufactured at the Landrévarzec site.
In 2023, production will total 800 tons (1000 tons in 2022) for the 4.6 million UVC site (up), of which 48% private label and 52% national brand (96% cake, 2% EU export, 3% Food service, 1% Freezer center). Few exports to Europe.
Partial activity with authorization from the authorities until July (3 or 4 days a week).
